javadoc: A utility class for working with Field objects.

methods.name: wrap
methods.comment: Splits the given FieldElement into sub-elements by wrapping the element on whitespace.

params.name: width
params.comment: The maximum width to allow before wrapping

methods.name: wordWrapList
methods.comment: Splits the given FieldElement into sub-elements by wrapping the element on whitespace.

params.name: width
params.comment: The maximum width to allow before wrapping

methods.name: findWordWrapPosition
methods.comment:
Finds the position within the given element at which to split the line for word wrapping.
 This method only breaks on whitespace characters. It finds the last whitespace character
 that completely fits within the given width.  If there is no whitespace character before
 the width break point, it finds the first whitespace character after the width.  If the
 element cannot be split at all, it returns 0.

params.name: width
params.comment: the max width to allow before looking for a word wrap positions

return.comment:
0 if the element cannot be split, else the character position of the string
 to be split off.

methods.name: trimString
methods.comment: Trims "goofy" characters off of the given label, like spaces, '[',']', etc.

name: FieldUtils
comment: A utility class for working with Field objects.
